snippet: The Brazilian police killed more than 11,000 people between 2009 and 2013, for an average of six killings a day, a public safety organization said Tuesday in a report.
abstract: Brazilian Forum on Public Safety study finds that Brazilian police killed 11,197 people from 2009 to 2013, for an average of six killings a day; says figures show that police make abusive use of lethal force to respond to crime and violence.
lead_paragraph: The Brazilian police killed more than 11,000 people between 2009 and 2013, for an average of six killings a day, a public safety organization said Tuesday in a report.

headline.main: Brazil: Police Killed 11,000 People Over Five-Year Period, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Brazil: Police Killed 11,000 People Over Five-Year Period, Report Says
